definitions.definition: to (cause to) move in a circle around a fixed point or line:
examples: The earth turns on its axis once every 24 hours.

definitions.definition: an opportunity or a duty to do something at a particular time or in a particular order, before or after other people:
When a number of people take turns, they do the same thing one after the other:
examples: We take turns answering the phone.

definitions.definition: one after the other in an agreed order:
examples: Each of us takes a break in turn.
